title: Patna Student Mocks The Govt's Inaction On The Flood Crisis While Mimicking Lalu Prasad Yadav
text:
Patna Student Mocks The Govt's Inaction On The Flood Crisis While Mimicking Lalu Prasad Yadav

Patna Student Mocks The Govt's Inaction On The Flood Crisis While Mimicking Lalu Prasad Yadav

Floods across Bihar have wreaked havoc and brought normal life to a standstill. The unprecedented rain in Patna has cost the lives of more than 55 people.

Even three days after the rain stopped water level in Patna is not receding which is now triggering fear of epidemic.

Twitter

And people are left with the government's inefficiency, to mock the officials lackadaisical attitude this Patna student mimicked Lalu Yadav and touched upon important issues.

A second-year political science student, Krishna Yadav stands atop a tractor in floodwater as he slams Chief Minister Nitish Kumar for the state government’s inaction in controlling the situation.

"For the last 15 years, Nitish Kumar is running double engine coalition govt with BJP, he must answer to the people of Patna for this condition," he says.

'Why there are no proper arrangements made by his government? Nitish Kumar must speak up' he says while mimicking Lalu Yadav.

Oh man! Is this the best mimicry of @laluprasadrjd yet by anyone? Must watch once! 😀 pic.twitter.com/ToVbcsUqON — Prashant Kumar (@scribe_prashant) October 3, 2019

While speaking to indianexpress.com, Yadav said that he didn’t have any intention of making a video at all. “Being a votary of Lalu Prasad Ji, my friends told me to talk about the flood havoc in his voice and I did. But I didn’t know that they were going to upload it and then expect it to go viral,” said Yadav.

The Bihar floods have become a huge embarrassment not just for the Chief Minister Nitish Kumar but for the opposition Rashtriya Janata Dal as well.

Tejashwi Yadav, son of jailed RJD chief Lalu Yadav and leader of the opposition, has once again been missing in action.

Tejasvi Yadav was today spotted in Haryana's Rewari where he has gone to accompany his brother-in-law Chiranjeevi Rao who today filed his nomination as Congress candidate.
